chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance 5th Offense

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael F. McCoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI 5th Offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**0 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Case 21CF74.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
(3:29 PM cases 21CF74, 22CF251 called.) Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael F. McCoy in court. Attorney David W. Field in court for Michael F. McCoy.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF74 Count 1: Identity Theft - Financial Gain, Count 3: Identity Theft - Financial Gain and 22CF251 Count 1: OWI 5th Offense.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights.
Prior offenses acknowledged. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CF74 Count 1, Count 3 and 22CF251 Count 1.
Parties request the Court follow the joint sentencing recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 3 years concurrent with the following conditions:
21CF74: 
90 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on Count 1. No contact with J.P., any Wells Fargo, M.M., J.C., S.A., Home 2 Suites in Eau Claire, WI. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. Restitution in the amount of $1,508.17 plus 5% and 10% surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs to include 1 bench warrant fee. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Defendant is to successfully complete Treatment Court. 0 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

22CF251:
$600.00 forfeiture/costs. Mayo Hospital blood draw fee. 1 year jail with Huber privileges with last 6 months stayed pending further order of the Court. Defendant may serve jail time in Dunn County if at no cost to Eau Claire County. 36 month driver's license revocation. 36 month ignition interlock device. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 0 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including cases 20TR1009, 20TR1010 are dismissed and read in.
